post.body: I haven't even heard of that book. Will definitely get a copy. But I need more fiction and poetry in the mix, too much nonfiction
yes, done both of those, thanks
now that is a book people have recommended before, but for some reason never bothered to. Hernando de Soto here I come
I'm sure I read von Hippel as a free download some years ago, must check, my memory may be going. And de Sautoy I loved.
thanks, read the Lessig, considered buying the Schumpeter but hadn't done so. Will do so now.
I'll get both those. And yes, I have read Out of Control. BTW I bought Nonzero at your suggestion some weeks ago, not read yet
Taleb seems to be a Marmite author, he evokes strong reactions from people. Yours is muted in comparison with your normal style!
@kevinmarks @fernandogros @lwarren17 thanks. Already read Pollan and Taleb and Fuhrman. Bought Nonzero. Rest are new to me.
see you at "Us Now" at the RSA tomorrow. I'll be there early, but need to head on straight after the screening and Q&A.
hope the Hamlet goes well for you.
furniture: n. a container you can sit on, usually holding various remote controls, some coins, some unidentified food particles & a pet
thanks, I have a signed copy of Halting State, loved the book.
thanks for the Marks recommendation, someone else mentioned it and I forgot, so your tweet reminded me
@lbutlr @positivechurn @vendorprisey thanks for the recommendations, this is turning out to be a very valuable exercise
flying, the price wasn't that different...
@dailytwitter I will be there from Monday night thru Wednesday night.
@bb42 love the "fire hazard" comment.
the essay I was referring to is here http://historymatters.gmu.edu/d/4954/
that's all right then, he's just a "theo".
i knew there was something strangely disturbing about your tweet. Couldn't put my finger on it. Then it came to me. Two Urmys.
I might be able to bring you a Canon Powershot late on Monday if you get no better offers, or a Nikon D50.
shows how old I'm getting, and how teetotal. I really had no idea what "lambrini" was, had to google it....
thanks, you gave me just the information I needed.
never marinated a big bird before. any hints?
there's a lot to work with there. Thanks
what kind of move?
thanks, will keep an eye out for posts from you on the subject
interesting tweet. Care to share more? How do you visualise the differences in decomposition of the problem domain?
thanks. They're fine now. We're very lucky that the only things that got hurt were the cars and the airbags
that's him at 50; this is him now-ish http://tinyurl.com/57b3k9
my favourite Mayall album has to be The Turning Point. Must have listened to California/Roxanne/Room to Move a zillion times.
thanks. Experimented with garbanzo bean & zucchini stew & potato pancakes, turned out well. Now it's time for Madagascar 2
thanks. appreciate it.
thanks. I'm a glutton for children's films. & toys. That's why my kids are 22, 16, 10. Spaced apart to give me an excuse for longer
@psd @jas @twishes thanks, I really appreciate your wishes and prayers
you're right, I just forgot everything else & went straight to them. Once I saw them and knew they were OK, things settled down
thanks for your wishes. BTW two copies of your book arrived. Now we have to meet, so that you can sign one to me. This year.
and the same to yours. I keep thanking God. The accident had enough momentum to set off airbags and shatter windscreens
@ddunwoody @lwarren17 thanks for your wishes. They're both fine. Seeing different perspectives of the twitter community.
commented on your post directly, and on your "behavior" :-)
and here's a reasonable recipe for singharas; replace cauliflower with whatever you want http://uktv.co.uk/food/recipe/aid/591615
here's a photograph of a singhara, sometimes spelt shingara http://www.flickr.com/photos/astrolondon/2813950537/
morning david. Are you in London this Friday, we may be able to meet then. DM me the details pls
are you going to be at Le Web?
you haven't lived until you've had the Calcutta equivalent of a samosa, a singhara. Samosas are triangles, singharas are pyramids.
that is an important post of yours http://tinyurl.com/5w54re
responded to Asymmetric Follow http://tinyurl.com/59zo8n
one month off the weed now? well done. As a recent ex (31 years on, 2.5 years off) I know how it feels
I wouldn't use *any* encyclopaedia for pure research. That's not a Wikipedia issue. And when I quote facts I should quote sources
my *very* personal favourite internet search story http://tinyurl.com/2tkjk5
OK, now I've caught up with the stories today about UK ISPs and Wikipedia, and understand the context of your comment.
didn't understand your last tweet. I'm missing something, I can use Wikipedia here without let or hindrance.
you may enjoy this http://tinyurl.com/5wrhw6 I wrote it two years ago
I'm working on three books in parallel and writing a chapter for a fourth. The four are quite different in style and coverage.
how about a sunhat for a convoy of people?
glad you liked it. Since 2002 or so I keep meeting people for the first time, people I've known for years. It's very satisfying.
you shouldn't be surprised. the reply exemplifies the post
all the best for sea:Flex
I'm here to meet friends at Le Web; I fly because I live near Heathrow and it's convenient for me, the prices aren't that different
thanks. now in Paris
interested in seeing where those bits land
thanks for pointing out a great version of Stand By Me
#andyasks i met her in church
thanks. will continue with the theme tonight
:-) yes, probably freudian. glad to be back home.
good to meet you as well. Where are you based?
you gave me the idea when you asked @patphelan how to do it :-)
we will :-)
you know how frustrated I felt about the wireless, so I was bound to do something. Old habits die hard. Don't complain, *fix*.
if you use the BB browser then you should also delete the caches
good. I am due in SF between 7 and 14 Jan, if you're around we will arrange to meet and agree what is to be done. @joshr h ...
we should talk early next year about wireless for Le Web 09
I didn't have to do very much, @patphelan pointed me at a site that did it all.
@patphelan pointed me to the right place after a tweet from @michelleoshen
you were asking who I was. Does this help?
myrto, you're too young to know those songs! But you're right, that was Gordon Lightfoot, The Mountains and Maryann
since the facility exists, maybe we should all start saving manuals in RTF. We could then call them RTF manuals.....
I saw that, what a silly move. We should all have a day of synchronised harrumphing of moustaches in protest to the ECB
used couscous instead of kasha. worked a treat. thanks
mushroom kasha burgers http://tinyurl.com/7dnxlx
they aren't particularly ambitious. Good recipes and a little practice go a long way. I learn a lot from cooking regularly
thanks, I will try them out. they have a tough act to beat though, epicurious is pretty good. excellent filters, good ratings.
the kids enjoyed it and i did not fall asleep.
you're welcome anytime you're anywhere near these parts
will provide the link when i am home, not easy via BlackBerry in cinema
will do, the film ends 2200 GMT
good morning
couldn't agree more, love that verse
thanks, will check out rescuetime, looks interesting
loving the recommendations you have made for my Christmas reading list, it's a simple and valuable use of twitter, beats blogs for speed
listening to the Ian Livingston Keynote Interview at Symposium 2008 for the second time, this time prompted by a notification via Facebook
Preparing for tonight before the day gets too busy. I will be at the RSA for Us Now http://tinyurl.com/6rxabh
thinking about the number of books i will need to stockpile for the Christmas break. i usually read 25 or so. what's your recommendation?
it's getting late for the new-fangled me. But I must be getting better. Medical insurance bounced my cardiologist bill :-)
finally an opensource platform-agnostic format-agnostic music player http://tinyurl.com/62mgwp
on my way to Olympia for Online Information 2008
delighted that @blaine has officially joined us now. Welcome, Blaine. @osmosoft, @ribbit et al, you have been warned :-)
thinking. getting my mind to quiet down.
coming to the end of a long day at work, then off to the RSA. Followed by dinner with @euan and friends at the new Corrigan place
collating all the reading recommendations that have flowed in as tweets; trying to figure out the best way to move the fiction slider up
noticing that #Songbird 1 is trending in Twitter. which is a good thing. posted about it last night BTW
trying to figure out where in feedburner I could see the locations of subscribers as an aggregate
trying to cram too much into today and into the weekend. Trying to make room for Le Web next week.
considering the lilies
coming to the end of a very long week. already dreaming of putting my feet up. thinking of open fires and pistachios and family chats
time to continue with Yashim the Eunuch http://tinyurl.com/5ht9k7=cm_cr_pr_product_top
back home. meetings done for the day. time to listen to some joni mitchell while savouring a samosa. everyone else is asleep.
thinking about reasons for the use of andy's nostrils and merde du diable in Indian cooking http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asafoetida
getting ready for a management meeting. one of those days
reading an essay on child-centeredness in progressive education, originally written in 1918. http://historymatters.gmu.edu/d/4954/
"Science is like sex; sometimes something useful comes out, but that's not the reason we are doing it." Richard Feynman
thinking about putting my feet up and settling down with the Janissary Tree and Yashim the Eunuch. Enjoyed it so much I've been slow-reading
just finished playing with freckle. interesting. need to think about it.
Just worked out that John Mayall is now over 75. Heard him "live" in the 80s, the 90s but missed his 70th birthday concert. Amazing man
Listening to John Mayall and the Bluesbreakers: Rambling on My Mind
back home from Madagascar.
EC1-LHR-CDG
coming to the end of a high speed morning, now off to catch a flight.
wading through the day's tasks like Mario and Luigi going off the reservation
off to have breakfast. one of those rare days when I eat something beyond a piece or two of fruit. Long day ahead of me, need to prepare.
doing my daily lemming impersonation. travelling remorselessly in the dark, zeroing in on work.
calling it a day. lots to do tomorrow before I go to Le Web.
wryly RT-ing @auren "more signs of a recession -- it is now *harder* to get a reservation at the cool, but inexpensive restaurants in SF
been having many wonderful conversations interspersed between some great sessions. now time to have dinner.
at lunch with @gapingvoid, @dhowlett, @dsearls, @ateveHill
done with the chores I needed to get done first thing. Now I can go on to Le Web
been working on some strategy papers since the early morning. Now time to go to my first meeting
now reading Joe Lansdale's latest, Leather Maiden
continuing to work on the one chapter
working on completing a chapter for a book, due urgently
had a bunch of wonderful conversations tonight. People I'd wanted to meet for years. Over time your electronic relationships materialise.
getting used to what Doc Searls called "public toilet" class of wireless connect at my hotel. getting used to it pixel by painful pixel
off to meet @shainberg at the gate. then it's LHR-CDG for me
looking forward to spending the evening with my wife and children. blogging later. Then up with the lark for the cricket.
on my way home after a long and fulfilling day. tomorrow i get to catch up on all the chores that need to be done every time i travel
delighted with the way the day has progressed; makes me realise that often, "time" is an unhelpful concept. "output" and "value" are better
fancy yourself as a DJ? RT @MCHammer: I just joined the DJs Twitter Group http://tgr.me/g/djs and you can too.
FT: Why Obama should take up cricket http://tinyurl.com/5eq7n4=1.html Ta to John Wilson for the tip
back in London. relishing the idea of going in to work in sunlight, something i havent been able to do for a while
boarding CDG LHR
working on a follow-up to my "Politeness and Continuous Partial Asymmetry" post http://www.tinyurl.com/59zo8n
working on a follow-up to my politeness and continuous partial asymmetry post http://www.tinyurl.com/59zo89
having to deal with questions I don't want to answer at this time of the morning. Should those microdoughnuts be eaten? They look enticing.
as you would expect of me, keeping an eye on the Chennai cricket scores until it's time to board. Been an eventful, successful Le Web for me
on lounge wifi. couldn't get on as BT Openzone guest. Tried Orange 1 hr free option. Failed on "zip code". Until I entered 5 digit rubbish.
on lounge wife. Couldn't get on as BT Openzone guest. Tried Orange 1 hour free option. Failed on "zip code" until I entered 5 digit rubbish.
realising how beautiful Paris is in the dark when there is no traffic
checking out of the Scribe Hotel, soon on my way to CDG en route LHR. long day awaits. a quiet eye on the cricket
back from dinner. early flight tomorrow, packing now. then a chance to think about what I have learnt, and what I'm going to do about it.
#cricket 112 balls between boundaries at Chennai, wonder what the Test record is.
now it requires genuine 24 karat optimism to visualise an Indian victory in Chennai. Good thing I know one of those. Me.
preparing to go to church. Can't keep an eye on the cricket scores, too much to do. Looks like India will have a lot to do. I live in hope.
getting ready for bed. probably read for fifteen minutes. today's one of those days when I will feel myself fall asleep eyelid by eyelid.
finally finished my preparations for tomorrow's preach. First time for me. Took about seven hours.
RT @mahemoff One should be able to search for events on Google Maps (like say "last.fm hack day")
listening to Miles Davis
family now asleep. working on my preach for tomorrow. research done, structure done, materials ready, now working on the rest
thinking about #TwitBard, wouldn't it be good to see some of the Shakespeare plays reduced to a single tweet in a different language?
RT @johndodds attempt at Merchant of Venice #TwitBard http://twitter.com/johndodds/status/1055735009
trying out deezer after a tweet from @jy. listening to joni mitchell singing both sides now
listening to Joni Mitchell Blue http://tinyurl.com/5u6dk5
back from a delightful dinner with friends. settling down for a quiet Friday night: read a few magazines, sleep, wake up, watch cricket
I can listen to Wooden Ships all evening. So many decent versions, so little time. Probably favour the Slick/Kantner version today
RT @patphelan $1500 phone being given away here, it's in aid of Crumlins Children's Hospital Cancer Ward http://bit/ly/Agmz
But I didn't and I wonder why I feel like letting my freak flag fly And I feel like I owe it to someone
listening to some early David Crosby, when he was with the Byrds. Eight Miles High. Renaissance Fair. That kind of stuff.
home now. two conference calls and then I'm done for the year. as if anybody is done for any year. as if the emperor hs clothes. doesn't he?
when I smile tell me some bad news before I laugh and act like a fool
musing abt (outdated) formal separation of work & play, how that affects our concepts of work-life balance, & about my use of "outdated"
Green tea with @dominicsayers. And I am now the proud possessor of Canteen: A Building Site Cookbook. Will try elderflower cheesecake first.
wishin' on a falling star/waitin' for the early train
travelling in to work for the last time this year. looking forward to some time at home with the family. they grow up so quickly. so quickly
andsotobed. need to wake up early. in case India bat and Sehwag does something like score the fastest ton ever
finally. iPlayer for the Mac. Seems to work fine so far, just been putting it through its paces.
First the Aussie tour in March, then the ICC Champions Trophy in Sep, now the Indian tour is cancelled. I just hope a neutral venue is found
and to fight for a cause they've long ago forgotten
and the vagabond within me cries/the wind and rain might burn my eyes/but I won't feel the pain/
imagining alloy primate castrati
freezing
peanut M&Ms. slowly. enjoyably.
taking my youngest daughter to see Bedtime Stories shortly.
very impressed with epicurious over the last year or so.
cooking dinner. mushroom/couscous burgers (made from scratch), sauteed potatoes, sugar snap peas, carrots.
Donald E Westlake RIP http://tinyurl.com/94ksor
green tea. then take the youngest out for a film, write an essay, cook dinner for the family. new plan. do a few things well every day.
MInus 5 outside. Which is cold for where I live. So I went to the barbers and got shaven and shorn as if it was midsummer in protest.
